intro: Hebanthe parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered hebanthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows as an herbaceous perennial. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its small, tubular flowers are usually pale purple or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
